turns.speaker: NEFF
turns.text: Wilder's missing church services; you believe it?

turns.speaker: KENAI
turns.text: I just as soon he stay gone. Fool could've got us all killed, arresting Ben Corbett here in town.

turns.speaker: NEFF
turns.text: Why the smirk?

turns.speaker: KENAI
turns.text: Bet I could make some money turning Ben Corbett in.  Maybe more for lettin' him loose.  I was up in my cache.  Saw the Northland man come talk to you.

turns.speaker: NEFF
turns.text: You're out of your greedy goddamn mind.

turns.speaker: KENAI
turns.text: Corbett coming here stinks of trouble.  We should make the best of it before it turns around and bites us in the ass.

turns.speaker: NEFF
turns.text: Stay out of it.

turns.speaker: NEFF
turns.text: He saw you and Corbett come in...

turns.speaker: KENAI
turns.text: Dixie's waiting at the infirmary. She'll put a splint on that injured leg.

turns.speaker: NEFF
turns.text: Dead.  Trappers killed him.

turns.speaker: KENAI
turns.text: Aw, Jesus.  Told you this was trouble.  What about you, big shot?  Do something.  Who's side are you on, anyway?

turns.speaker: VIKING BOB
turns.text: LeMalle.  We got a problem. Where's Mitchell?

turns.speaker: LEMALLE
turns.text: Goddamn!  Viking Bob!  Mitchell's inside, boring bastard...

turns.speaker: LEMALLE
turns.text: There you go.  Wilder's always chummy with the fuckin' Bambi-lovers.

turns.speaker: VIKING BOB
turns.text: It's a long shot.

turns.speaker: VIKING BOB
turns.text: I called the cops in Fairbanks, see when Ben is standing trial. They don't know shit about Ben or Wilder!

turns.speaker: LEMALLE
turns.text: Get the fuck out of here.

turns.speaker: VIKING BOB
turns.text: It's a three-hour flight.  They shoulda got there yesterday.

turns.speaker: LEMALLE
turns.text: Maybe they went back to Devil's Cauldron.

turns.speaker: VIKING BOB
turns.text: Go easy.

turns.speaker: LEMALLE
turns.text: Cool out.  I ain't about to get blasted.

turns.speaker: LEMALLE
turns.text: I ain't gonna leave a seven- hundred-dollar Remington behind.

turns.speaker: VIKING BOB
turns.text: What you gonna do with it?  Large bore's for shit on small game.

turns.speaker: LEMALLE
turns.text: Not in the right hands it ain't.

turns.speaker: LEMALLE
turns.text: Thought that door was open last night...

turns.speaker: VIKING BOB
turns.text: Quit fucking around.  Get in.

turns.speaker: VIKING BOB
turns.text: Look, we pull Ben's ass out of the fire, I'll get you a whole damn crate of Snickers bars.

turns.speaker: LEMALLE
turns.text: I'm right fuckin' here with you.

turns.speaker: LEMALLE
turns.text: You hear me?  Ben?

turns.speaker: VIKING BOB
turns.text: Ease off.  We do this my way.

turns.speaker: LEMALLE
turns.text: Kenai's PA -- but how the fuck she seein' us?

turns.speaker: VIKING BOB
turns.text: Doesn't matter.  We know where they're going.  C'mon.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: ...Ben never sent a signal.

turns.speaker: VIKING BOB
turns.text: Musta never got a chance to -more-

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Meaning he'll need a plane.

turns.speaker: VIKING BOB
turns.text: Closest planes for hire are here in Cache.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Hang on...  Remember that Cessna we saw at the pumping station on the Haul Road?  Belongs to the guy they got patrolling the pipeline.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Naah, Wilder knows we got friends in town.

turns.speaker: VIKING BOB
turns.text: That plane might've been to throw us off the track.  Remember the bait-and-switch Wilder pulled with the Eskimo and his truck?

turns.speaker: VIKING BOB
turns.text: Okay, let's backtrack, try to pick up his trail.  You know the kid out on the pipeline that Wilder's buddies with?

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: We were just talking about him.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: It's Sam Wilder!

turns.speaker: VIKING BOB
turns.text: Musta wanted to keep him from the bears.  If Ben killed him, he sure as hell wouldn't hang him up like this.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Where's the kid?

turns.speaker: VIKING BOB
turns.text: There's what they're waiting on!

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: They'll have to come right past us.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: This is Sam Wilder, Marshal in Devil's Cauldron.  Had some killings here.  I got a suspect; be real nice if someone came and took him off my hands.

turns.speaker: STATE POLICEMAN
turns.text: On a good day I couldn't spare a crosswalk guard.  But now, no way.  Folks're batshit with the weather turning sour.  Bring him in yourself.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: Next plane's not coming 'til next Monday.

turns.speaker: STATE POLICEMAN
turns.text: Sit your suspect out in the cold. He'll keep.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: This man's friends ain't gonna look favorably on his incarceration.

turns.speaker: STATE POLICEMAN
turns.text: So shoot him.  Won't have to feed him that way --

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: I didn't know you had a secret admire.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: You met the gift.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: There is a seriously goofy man behind this. You are not allowed to block out that fact.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: Do you really want to go back to the runt doctors in Emergency who keep telling us they can't help?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: It lets a crazy man into our lives.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: Come on. Why fight when we know how it will come out. This isn't like stocking or a string of pearls. You don't send this one back.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: You're not still writing that thank-you note?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I'm on the last page. How do you spell conscience?

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: C-o-n-s-c-i-e-n-c-e. I got Sean from the bakery to baby-sit so let's go out.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I still don't feel safe leaving Spencer with someone. How do you spell it again?

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: Spencer is okay. You'd better start finding something else to do with your free time. If you can't feel good about this break and step out a little...  You ought to get Mr. Udall to send you over a psychiatrist.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I don't need one 'cause I know what's really going on here. I have to finish this letter or I'll go nuts.  This can't be right -- con- science.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I don't know... It's very strange not feeling that stupid panic thing inside you all the time. Without that you just start thinking about yourself -- and what does that ever get anybody. Today, on the bus there was this adorable couple and I felt myself giving them a dirty look -- I had no idea everything was...

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: Go ahead.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: ... moving in the wrong direction... Away from when I even remembered what it was like to have a man to... anything... hold fucking -- sorry -- hands with, for Christ's sake. I was feeling like really bad that Dr. Bettes is married.  Which is probably why I make poor Spencer hug me more than he wants to... Like the poor kid doesn't have enough problems. He has to make up for his mom not getting any.  Oh, boy. Who needs these thoughts?

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: Spencer's doing fine. So what are you saying, that you're frustr...

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Leave me be! Why are you doing this? Why are you picking at my sores... What is it that you want?... You want what? What's with you? I hope getting me thinking of everything that's wrong when all I want is to not do this has some purpose.  What is it, Mom? No kidding.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: What is it you want? What?

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: I want us to go out.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: How was it talking to him?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Stop treating this like I'm going away with a man. He's just going to say those crappy, sick, complaining, angry things to me. I hate this, Mom -- I hate this. He's a freak show -- the worst person I ever met.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: Well, maybe he has nice friends.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: Call me as soon as you're settled.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I love you.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Stop it!! Why can't I have a normal boyfriend??? Why? Get out of here. Just a regular boyfriend who doesn't go nuts on me...

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: Everybody wants that, dear -- it doesn't exit...  Sorry... didn't mean to interrupt.

turns.speaker: SPENCER
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Don't be silly. How bad?

turns.speaker: SPENCER
turns.text: Not bad.

turns.speaker: SPENCER
turns.text: Hi...  Did you know there are doctors who come to your house?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: No, I didn't.  So why are you h...

turns.speaker: SPENCER
turns.text: He's good...  And I'm an expert on doctors.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Stay out of this...  Doctor?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Do you love me?

turns.speaker: SPENCER
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: What? Please? Now? Tell me?!

turns.speaker: DR. BETTES
turns.text: Mrs. Connelly. I'm Martin Bettes ...  Dr. Bettes.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Not your name...  what are you telling me your name for!! Where is he?

turns.speaker: DR. BETTES
turns.text: He's in the bathroom...  He's fine.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Tell me how bad it is. I let him go out last night when it was so cool without an overshirt -- just and underone with just the straps and I know better...  and I let him talk me into it. He was whining and...  you don't need this. Give me a second to catch hold.

turns.speaker: DR. BETTES
turns.text: My wife is Melvin Udall's publisher.  She says I have to take great care of this guy because you're urgently needed back at work. What work do you do?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I'm a waitress.

turns.speaker: DR. BETTES
turns.text: How long has he been having problems?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Since forever.

turns.speaker: DR. BETTES
turns.text: Have they done blood tests on him?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DR. BETTES
turns.text: Only in the emergency room or when he was well.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Emergency room only.

turns.speaker: DR. BETTES
turns.text: Have they done skin testing for allergies?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DR. BETTES
turns.text: They haven't done the standard scratch test. Where they make small injections into the skin?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: No. I asked. They said it's not covered under my plan. And it's not necessary anyway.

turns.speaker: DR. BETTES
turns.text: It's amazing these things weren't done.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Fucking H.M.O. bastard piece of shit...  I'm sorry...  forgive me.

turns.speaker: DR. BETTES
turns.text: No. Actually, I think that's their technical name.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Once the tests come back, is there someone I can reach in your office for the results?

turns.speaker: DR. BETTES
turns.text: Me. My home number is on this card.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: His home number.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Do you want some juice or coffee or two female slaves?

turns.speaker: DR. BETTES
turns.text: Water...  Nobody told you it might be a good idea to remove the carpeting and drapes in Spencer's room?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Doc!!!  So listen, you gotta let me know about the additional costs -- one way or the other we'll...

turns.speaker: DR. BETTES
turns.text: They're considerable. But Mr. Udall wants to be billed.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I'm starving.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Will you please take it?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I know. He's just the best.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I've got Jews at my table.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: It's not your table. It's the place's table. Behave. This once, you can sit at someone else's station.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: The table's fine if it had some cholesterol on it. Two sausages, six bacon strips, fries, three eggs over easy and coffee.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: You're gonna die soon with that diet, you know that?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: We're all gonna die soon. I will. You will. It sure sounds like your son will.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Clippity clop -- clippity clop -- she has to pretend she doesn't hear me. Listening to the story from the upset friend...  now she drops off the cappuccino and smiles at the putzette who doesn't even say, "Thank you." No, the putzette wanted the whipped cream so back she goes and now she has to pass him again and it's getting tougher to make believe.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: What's with the plastic picnic ware? Why not try ours...  afraid it isn't clean?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I see the help -- judgement call.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Just give yourself a little pep talk. "Must try other people's clean silverware as part of the fun of dining out."

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: What's wrong with your son, anyway?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: What do you care?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: He's gotta fight to breathe. His asthma can just shoot off the charts -- he's allergic to dust and this is New York and his immune system bails on him when there's trouble so an ear infection...  Is this bothering you?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: An ear infection can send us to the emergency room -- maybe five, six times a month where I get whatever nine-year-old they just made a doctor. Nice chatting with you.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: His name?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Spencer.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Spence.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: So what are you doing with a dog?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Suckered in. Set up. Pushed around.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: You're not worried that someone might take him?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Well, not until now -- for Christ's sake.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: It's okay -- I'll sit here.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: You know he's a little dog. Next time, if Bryan's not here, you can bring him in.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: How old are you?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Oh, please...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: If I had to guess by your eyes, I'd say you were fifty.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: And if I had to guess by your eyes. I'd say you were kind. So, so much for eyes. But as long as you bring up age...  how old are you?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Otherwise, you're not ugly.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Okay, pal...  I accept the compliment, but go easy -- my knees start a-knocking when you turn on the charm full blast.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: What's with the dark?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Last week I was playing the piano for him and he likes it, and so I decide I'm going to make a little joke...

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: You all set here?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I'm hungry.  You've upset my whole day. I haven't eaten.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: This is not a sexist thing. If you were a waiter I would still be here saying...

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Are you totally gone? This is my private home...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I am trying to keep emotions out of this. Even though this is an important issue to me and I have strong feelings about the subject.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: What subject? That I wasn't there to take crap from you and bring you eggs? Do you have any control over how creepy you allow yourself to get?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Yes, I do, as a matter of fact... and to prove it I have not gotten personal and you have. Why aren't you at work? You're not sick -- you don't look sick... just very tired and bitter.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: My son is sick, okay?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: What about your mother?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: How do you know about my mother?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I hear you talk when I'm waiting!!!

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Sorry, honey...  I'll be right there.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: How ya doing?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Yeah, yeah...  any chance you'll get back to work today?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: No!!! Stay away from me!

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Uh, Udall?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Carol the waitress?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: The doctors had your billing address. I'm sorry about the hour.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I was working...  can't you just drop me a thank-you note?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: That's not why I'm here...  ...  though you have no idea what it's like to have a real conversation with a doctor about Spencer...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Note. Put it in the note.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Why did yo do this for me?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: To get you back at work so you can wait on me.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: But you do have some idea how strange that sounds??? I'm worried that you did this because...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: You waiting for me to say something?  What sort of thing do you want? Look, I'll be at the restaurant tomorrow.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I don't think I can wait until tomorrow. This needs clearing up.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: What needs clearing up?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I'm not going to sleep with you. I will never, ever sleep with you. Never. Not ever.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I'm not kidding.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Okay!!!! Anything else?!?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Just how grateful I am.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: So you'll be at work?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: A thank-you note for what you did for me.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Getting loud, getting loud.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: He wants me to take his car and his client to Baltimore.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I want your life for a minute where my big problem is someone offers me a free convertible so I can get out of this city.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: So. Anything else?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Yes. I'm going to give my queer neighbor a lift to Baltimore.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Hey, what I did for you is working out?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: What you did changed my life.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: No... no thank you notes.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Well, part of what I said in this entire history of my life which you won't read is that somehow you've done more for my mother, my son and me, than anyone else ever has... And that makes you the most important, surprising, generous person I've ever met and that you be in our daily prayers forever.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Lovely.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I also wrote one part... I wrote I'm sorry... I was talking about I was sorry when I got mad at you when you came over and you told my son that he ought to answer back so I wrote that.  I was sorry for busting you on that... and I'm sorry for busting in on you that night... when I said I was never... I was sorry and I'm sorry every time your food was cold and that you had to wait two seconds for a coffee filler...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Nice of you... thank you.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Now I want you to do something for me.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Oh, I'm sorry... Didn't I say, "what?" I thought I said, "what?"... What?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I want you to go on this trip.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: No, sir...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I can't do this alone. I'm afraid he'll pull the stiff one eye on me. I need you to chaperon. Separate everything but cars. You said you liked convertibles. Now I'm on the hook.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: The stiff one eye?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Two days.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I can't. I work.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: You take off when you have to.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: My son.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Bettes tells me he's doing fine.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Melvin, I'd rather not.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: What's that got to do with it?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Funny, I thought it was a strong point.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Write me a note and ain't she sweet. I need a hand and where'd she go.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Are you saying accepting your help obligates me!?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Is there another way to see it?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Are you still coming?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Melvin... I'd like to know exactly where we are going.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Just south to Baltimore, Maryland. So I know what you're going to ask next.  That you might ask -- I'm not certain.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: There's... there's no need to bring anything dressy... or... I mean -- I didn't know if we'd be eating at any restaurant that have dress codes.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Oh.  We might. Yes. We can. Let's.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Okay, gotcha. What did you think I was going to ask?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Whether crabs are in season there now...

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Oh. Okay, then -- Melvin. Good night.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Thanks for being on time... Carol, the waitress, this is Simon, the fag.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Hello... Oh, my God, who did that to you?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I was going to do that for you.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: It's okay. No problem. Where should we sit?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I -- uh, I... Well, there is no place cards or anything.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Let me go in back. You look like you need all the room you can manage.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Thanks, Melvin.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Welcome.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I'm sure, Simon, they did something real off for you to feel this way... But when it comes to your partners -- or your kid -- things will always be off for you unless you set it straight. Maybe this thing happened to you just to give you that chance.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Nonsense!

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Anybody here who's interested in what Melvin has to say raise their hands.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Hey -- you let him...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: You like sad stories -- you want mine.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: ... my father didn't leave his room for 11 years -- he hit my hand with a yardstick if I made a mistake on the piano.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Go ahead, Simon. Your father walked in on you and was yelling and... really, come on.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: That's not true. Some of us have great stories... pretty stories that take place at lakes with boats and friends and noodle salad. Just not anybody in this car. But lots of people -- that's their story -- good times and noodle salad... and that's what makes it hard. Not that you had it bad but being that pissed that so many had it good.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: No answer... Maybe we should just drive there tomorrow. Can I have that one?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Yes... sure.  I'll take the sofa.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: My son was outside playing soccer. I never saw him playing ball. Come on, you guys -- take me out for a good time... Take me out dancing.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Dancing?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Stop asking everyone.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Just him and that's it. Okay, you can answer -- we've worked it out.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: No... I'm not wearing that -- and just in case you were going to ask I'm not going to let you inject me with plaque either.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: You promised a nice place -- can't you just...  You have these dry cleaned all the time, don't you?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: You wanna dance?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I've been thinking about that since you brought it up before.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: No...  ... I don't get this place. They make me buy an outfit but they let you wear a house dress. I don't get it.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: No. Wait. What? Why? I didn't mean it. You gotta sit down. You can still give me the dirty look... just sit down and give it to me.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Melvin, pay me a compliment... I need one and quick... You have no idea how much what you said just hurt my feelings.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: That monominute somebody gets that you need them they threaten to go away. Never fails.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: That's not compliment, Melvin... That's just trying to sound smart so I feel stupid... A compliment is something nice about somebody else... Now or never.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: And mean it...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Can we order first?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Two crab dinners and pitcher of cold beer.  Baked or fries?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Fries.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: One baked -- one fries.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I am so afraid you're about to say something awful...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Don't be pessimistic. It's not your style. Okay... Here I goes... Clearly a mistake.  I have this -- what? Ailment... And my doctor -- a shrink... who I used to see all the time... he says 50 or 60 percent of the time a pill can really help. I hate pills. Very dangerous things, pills. "Hate," I am using the word "hate" about pills. My compliment is that when you came to my house that time and told me how you'd never -- well, you were there, you know... The next morning I started taking these pills.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I don't quite get how that's a compliment for me.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: That's maybe the best compliment of my life.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Then I've really overshot here 'cause I was aiming at just enough to keep you from walking out.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: So how are you doing with those pills? Well, I hopahopahopa.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Takes months to know... They work little by little.  Talking like this is exhausting.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Have you ever let a romantic moment make you do something you know is stupid?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Never.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Here's the trouble with never.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: You don't owe me that.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: That wasn't payment. When you first came into breakfast, when I saw you -- I thought you were handsome... Then, of course, you spoke... So now that your soft li'l underbelly is all exposed. Tell me, why did you bring me?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Well, ah... that's a personal question.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Tell me even if you're scared. Tell me why you wanted me here. It's okay.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: If you ask me... I'll say, "yes."

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: There are lots of reason... I had a thought that if you had sex with Simon it might...

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Sex with Simon?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: It's one idea...

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: That's why you brought me? Look at me! Is that really why you brought me... Like I'm a what and I owe you what?!

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I don't know why I brought you -- that idea occurred to me is all... It came out first... Hey, you kiss him -- me... He says he loves you. You two hit it off. But you don't want to... fine... Forget what I said about sex with Simon. It was a mistake.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I'll never forget you said it.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: It was a mistake.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Sorry, didn't realize she was right there.  Did you have sex with her?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: To hell with sex.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Nothing like no choice to make you feel at home.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Let me see... Ahh, gorgeous!

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Do it then. Get the dog picked up. I can't believe you let it stay there.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I don't want to hear that music right now.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: What do you mean? You said you liked it.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I don't.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: This one has a special meaning.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: It's your car but I don't want to hear it. If that means anything.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Here are the keys to my apartment. I'm going to park you in my place while I take Carol home.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I'll take a bus.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I'll take you... why not?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I don't care what you did for me. I don't think I want to know you anymore -- all you do is make me feel badly about myself.  You have my number.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Yeah... Well...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: How you doing?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I can trust my brain.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: That seems like a good choice.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I don't know whether I'm being sensible or hard on you.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: The two might go together.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: See. There's an example. I don't know whether you're being cute or crazy now.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Cute.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: You don't have to answer everything I say. Just listen to me. Okay?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Okay to say something now?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Go ahead.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I should've danced with you.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Okay. Good-bye.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: So long.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: What do you want, Melvin?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Were you asleep?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: 'Cause if you were asleep -- I'm sorry. And you could be grouchy.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Grouchy?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: ... 'Cause of being woken up, and it would make my job impossible. So then I wouldn't even try.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: What job?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Were you asleep?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I wasn't asleep!!

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: What a break...

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Is it a secret what you're doing here?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I had to see you...

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Because...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: It relaxes me... I'd feel better just sitting on the curb in front of your house than anyplace else I can think of or imagine.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Boyfriend?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Oh, come on in and try not to ruin everything by being you.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Maybe we could live without the wise cracks.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: It feels a little confined here. Let's take a walk.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: See. It's four in the morning. A walk sounds a little screwy to me, if you don't mind.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: If you need an excuse, there's a bakery on the corner. There's a shot it'll open soon -- that way we're not screwy -- we're just two people who like warm rolls.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I'm feeling... I've been feeling better.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Melvin, even though it may seem that way now -- you don't know me all that well...  I'm not the answer for you.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Hey, I've got a great compliment for you.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: You know what? I...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Just let me talk.  I'm the only one on the face of the earth who realizes that you're the greatest woman on earth. I'm the only one who appreciates how amazing you are in every single thing you do -- in every single thought you have... in how you are with Spencer -- Spence...  ... in how you say what you mean and how you almost always mean something that's all about being straight and good...

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: No! It's certainly not. No -- I don't think so. No.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I'm gonna grab you.  I didn't mean it to be a question. I'm gonna grab you.
